summary: This document contains an Amazon.com order confirmation email from March 2005 and a FedEx shipping label from September 2005, both addressed to Jeffrey Epstein at his Palm Beach residence. The Amazon order includes books on BDSM and erotic servitude. The document also includes a fragment of a Palm Beach Police evidence log.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Appears as the billing and shipping recipient for an Amazon.com order and a FedEx shipment sent to his Palm Beach, Florida address.

persons.name: Guy Baldwin
persons.context: Author of the book 'SlaveCraft: Roadmaps for Erotic Servitude' purchased in the Amazon order.

persons.name: Christina Abernathy
persons.context: Author of the book 'Training With Miss Abernathy: A Workbook for Erotic Slaves and Their Owners' purchased in the Amazon order.

events.title: Amazon.com Order Placed
events.description: An order is placed on Amazon.com for books including 'SM 101: A Realistic Introduction', 'SlaveCraft: Roadmaps for Erotic Servitude', and 'Training With Miss Abernathy: A Workbook for Erotic Slaves and Their Owners'.

events.title: FedEx Shipment
events.description: A FedEx Priority Overnight shipment is prepared for delivery to Jeffrey Epstein's Palm Beach address.

locations: 358 El Brillo Way, Palm Beach, Florida 33480
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein purchased books on BDSM and erotic servitude from Amazon.com in 2005, including 'SM 101', 'SlaveCraft', and 'Training With Miss Abernathy'.
The shipping and billing address for the Amazon order and a subsequent FedEx shipment was Epstein's residence at 358 El Brillo Way, Palm Beach, Florida.
The document includes a fragment of a Palm Beach Police evidence log, suggesting this material was collected as part of a law enforcement investigation.
